text: Heme, or haem (pronounced /hi:m/ HEEM), is a precursor to hemoglobin. It is necessary to bind oxygen in the circulatory system. Heme is made in both the bone marrow and the liver. ==Function== Hemes can do many things, such as catalyse reactions or move chemicals. Hemes are usually bound to proteins, and make hemoproteins. Examples of hemoproteins include hemoglobin, myoglobin, leghemoglobin, and cytochrome. == Related pages == * Myoglobin * Leghemoglobin * Cytochrome Category:Iron compounds
title: Heme
